title: Chicken, Apple, and Brussels Sprout Sheet Pan Dinner Recipe
description: Save time on weeknights with this easy sheet pan dinner of chicken thighs, apples, pancetta, and Brussels sprouts tossed in olive oil and herbs.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Fruits and Vegetables Vegetables Brussels Sprouts Roasted Chicken, Apple, and Brussels Sprout Sheet Pan Dinner 4.3 (31) 28 Reviews 6 Photos If you're looking for the easiest dinner imaginable (short of takeout), sheet pan recipes are the perfect thing for you. This one, with chicken, apple, and Brussels sprouts, is not only easy to cook, but even easier to clean! Serve it alone or with rice/salad. Submitted by My Stir Crazy Kitchen Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Total Time: 55 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 6 chicken thighs Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 cups Brussels sprouts, halved 1 red apple, cut into 1-inch cubes 1 (4 ounce) package pancetta 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided 1 teaspoon minced fresh rosemary 6 skinless, boneless chicken thighs salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Toss Brussels sprouts, apple, and pancetta with 1 tablespoon olive oil and rosemary in a bowl. Spread into a single layer on a sheet pan. Leave space on the pan for the chicken thighs. Toss chicken with the remaining 1 tablespoon oil in the same bowl; place on the sheet pan. Sprinkle salt and pepper on top. Bake in the preheated oven, stirring the Brussels sprouts mixture every 15 minutes, until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 40 to 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Cook's Note: Use your favorite herb instead of rosemary, if desired. I Made It Print 43 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Chicken, Apple, and Brussels Sprout Sheet Pan Dinner 01 of 06 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 06 Photo by  ReneePaj 12/17/2021 Served this with brown rice. Easy recipe. I only needed to cook for 30 minutes in my oven and everything came out perfect. I subbed bacon for pancetta and a green apple for red. Good flavors. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I'd make this again. Hubby ate it all. 03 of 06 Photo by  Drake Kohn 06/08/2020 Tasty recipe with the pancetta really adding some flavor and the apple adding a nice layer to it all. 04 of 06 Photo by  Thomas Rance 01/07/2019 05 of 06 Photo by  My Stir Crazy Kitchen 02/01/2018 1 You’ll Also Love Maple-Roasted Chicken Thighs 36 Ratings Lemon Garlic Shrimp with Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Brown Rice Sheet Pan Roasted Chicken Thighs with Brussels Sprouts 20 Ratings Autumn Rainbow Sheet Pan Dinner 29 Ratings Make-Ahead Sausage and Veggie Bowls 1 Rating Roasted Apples and Brussels Sprouts 186 Ratings Sheet Pan Chicken and Veggies with Mustard Vinaigrette 11 Ratings Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Kielbasa 89 Ratings Roast Chicken with Apples, Leeks, and Rosemary 5 Ratings Spicy Brussels Sprout Chips 32 Ratings Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Pears 8 Ratings Apple Honey Glazed Chicken 77 Ratings Oktoberfest Chicken and Red Cabbage 115 Ratings Basic Sheet Pan Chicken Sausage and Roasted Cabbage 10 Ratings Crispy Parmesan-Crusted Roasted Brussels Sprouts 33 Ratings Sheet Pan Chicken with Mozzarella, Pesto, and Broccoli 41 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: My Stir Crazy Kitchen
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).;Toss Brussels sprouts, apple, and pancetta with 1 tablespoon olive oil and rosemary in a bowl. Spread into a single layer on a sheet pan.;Leave space on the pan for the chicken thighs. Toss chicken with the remaining 1 tablespoon oil in the same bowl; place on the sheet pan. Sprinkle salt and pepper on top.;Bake in the preheated oven, stirring the Brussels sprouts mixture every 15 minutes, until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 40 to 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
